Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a square discus decorated with a palmette; there is one main and four subsidiary filling-holes, and an air-hole. The shoulder is decorated with a branch pattern. At the rear is a pierced handle. The nozzle and handle are flanked by triangular panels, each decorated with ring-and-dot patterns. The oval base is defined by two grooves; within is the impressed or incised name XIO|NH|C.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q3283)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Wellcome Institute for the History of Medicine (trustees)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Sir Henry Solomon Wellcome
